fields.summary: iOS7 Package: non-public selectors in Payload during app validation when distribute for Apple iTunes Store

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I tried to submit my app with the latest build of Titanium.
When Xcode validate the app before it sends it to the App Store it gives me a warning :
"The app references non-public selectors in Payload/My App.app/My App: push:"

I use Push in my app with the Ti.Network.registerForPushNotifications method.
You can see the implementation in the attachments.

Apple is very strict with this kind of warning, and I think the app will be rejected at review.
fields.summary: iOS7 Xcode validation for App Store : Warning "app references non public selectors"
fields.environment: iOS7 GM, Xcode 5.0 GM, Titanium 3.1.3 RC, Alloy 1.2.2-beta, Titanium Studio build: 3.1.2.201308091617

comments.body: This duplicates the linked issue which has been resolved. Please add additional comments there.
